employment_service.name: Employment & Service
employment_service.description: Rules regarding appointments, probation, and service conditions

questions.question: Which body is constitutionally empowered to appoint persons into senior posts (GL.07 and above) in the Federal Civil Service?
options: Office of the Head of the Civil Service
questions.explanation: According to PSR 020102, the Federal Civil Service Commission is responsible for appointments into senior posts GL.07 and above.

questions.question: What is the mandatory age eligibility criterion for appointment into the Federal Public Service?
options: Not less than 21 years and not more than 55 years of age
Not less than 18 years and not more than 50 years of age
Not less than 25 years and not more than 45 years of age
Not less than 20 years and not more than 60 years of age
questions.explanation: To be eligible for appointment, an applicant must be not less than 18 years and not more than 50 years of age, including computer literacy requirements.

questions.question: What is the mandatory maximum period an officer is required to serve on probation before being confirmed in the Service?
questions.explanation: Officers on probation will be required to serve for two years before being confirmed in the Service, though this period may be reduced.

questions.question: What document must all newly appointed officers immediately enter their personal particulars into upon assumption of duty?
questions.explanation: Immediately upon assumption of duty, a newly appointed officer is required to enter his personal particulars on Form Gen. 60 (Staff Records Form).

questions.question: Recruitment is defined as the filling of vacancies by direct appointment of persons not already in the Federal Public Service, but it explicitly excludes which category of movement?
options: Transfer of officers from other Public Service to the Federal Public Service
questions.explanation: Recruitment means the filling of vacancies... but it excludes the transfer of officers from other Public Service in the Federation to the Federal Public Service.

questions.question: The three papers compulsorily required for Senior Executive Officers/Administrative Officers (COMPRO I & II) include the Public Service Rules (PSR), General Paper, and which other core subject area?
questions.explanation: The COMPRO examination for GL 07 and above includes Public Service Rules (PSR), Financial Regulations (FR), Civil Service Handbook, and Establishment Circulars as reference books.

leave_medical.name: Leave & Medical
leave_medical.description: Rules regarding various types of leave and medical benefits

questions.question: What is the standard annual leave entitlement for Senior Officers on Grade Level 07 and above?
questions.explanation: Annual Leave entitlement for GL 07 and above is 30 working days.

questions.question: The maximum duration for which a female officer who is nursing a child shall be granted time off two hours off-duty every day after maternity leave is:
questions.explanation: A female Officer who is nursing a child shall be granted two hours off-duty every day... for a maximum period of six months from the date she resumes duty from maternity leave.

compensation_benefits.name: Compensation & Benefits
compensation_benefits.description: Rules regarding salaries, allowances, and other benefits

questions.question: Resettlement Allowance shall be paid upon transfer at what rate of an Officer's annual total emolument?
questions.explanation: Resettlement Allowance shall be paid at the rate of 2% of an Officer's annual total emolument.

conduct_discipline.name: Conduct & Discipline
conduct_discipline.description: Rules regarding professional conduct and disciplinary procedures

questions.question: An officer under investigation for a serious offense who is placed on temporary removal from duties and earns **no salary** is deemed to be under:
questions.explanation: Suspension means removal of an Officer from performing the duties of his office... during which period he shall earn **no salary**. Interdiction involves half salary.

questions.question: Which of the following is defined as a 'Serious Misconduct' that may lead to dismissal from the Service?
questions.explanation: Serious Misconduct includes Falsification of records, Corruption, Bribery, Engaging in partisan political activities, and **Absence from duty without leave**.

performance_development.name: Performance & Development
performance_development.description: Rules regarding performance management and career development

questions.question: The Performance Management Cycle shall run annually from:
options: April to March of the following year
September to August of the following year
January to December of every year
The date of the last promotion to the next promotion due date
questions.explanation: The Performance Management Cycle shall run from January to December of every year.

questions.question: Sabbatical Leave is granted to an officer on GL 15 or equivalent and above, for a period of:
options: Six calendar months, once every three years
Twelve calendar months, once in five (5) years
questions.explanation: Sabbatical Leave applies to an officer on GL 15 or equivalent and above... for a period of twelve (12) calendar months once in five (5) years.

questions.question: What is the mandatory retirement requirement for all grades in the Federal Civil Service?
options: 55 years of age or 30 years of pensionable service
60 years of age or 35 years of pensionable service, whichever is earlier
65 years of age or 40 years of pensionable service
questions.explanation: The mandatory retirement age for all grades in the Service shall be 60 years or 35 years of pensionable service, whichever is earlier.

travel.name: Travel Regulations
travel.description: Rules and procedures related to official travel

questions.question: Which document is essential for processing official travel claims, alongside complete travel itinerary and receipts?
questions.explanation: Boarding passes/Tickets are essential for processing travel claims, confirming the officer actually traveled.

questions.question: An officer returning from official travel must submit a comprehensive travel report within:
questions.explanation: A comprehensive travel report must be submitted within 7 days of returning from official travel.

property_management.name: Property Management
property_management.description: Rules and procedures related to management and use of government property

questions.question: The maximum period for which government property (like motor vehicles or equipment) can be loaned to an officer is:
questions.explanation: The maximum period for which government property can be loaned to an officer is 90 days.

appointments.name: Appointments, Confirmation & Promotions
appointments.description: Rules and procedures for appointments, probation, confirmation, and promotions in the public service

questions.question: Which body is constitutionally empowered to appoint persons into senior posts (GL.07 and above) in the Federal Civil Service?
options: Office of the Head of the Civil Service
questions.explanation: According to PSR 020102, the Federal Civil Service Commission is responsible for appointments into senior posts GL.07 and above.

questions.question: Under PSR 020301, what is the maximum probationary period before confirmation?
questions.explanation: PSR 020301 states that probation should not exceed two years, subject to satisfactory performance and passing prescribed examinations.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a recognized type of appointment under PSR 020201?
questions.explanation: PSR recognizes appointments such as probationary, temporary, and contract. Political appointment is not covered under PSR but under political guidelines.

questions.question: According to PSR 020210, which form is required to be signed by all new appointees?
questions.explanation: PSR 020210 mandates that all new appointees must sign the Oath of Secrecy Form before assumption of duty.

questions.question: Which factor primarily determines seniority among officers appointed on the same date?
questions.explanation: Seniority among officers appointed on the same date is determined by their grade level at appointment, with higher-grade officers taking precedence.

questions.question: According to PSR 020207, an officer is considered eligible for appointment into the Federal Public Service if:
options: They are a member of a registered trade union
They meet the minimum educational requirements and are medically fit
They have worked in the private sector for at least 5 years
questions.explanation: PSR 020207 states that eligibility for appointment is based on meeting minimum educational qualifications and medical fitness, among other criteria.

questions.question: PSR 020209 prohibits membership of which type of organization for public officers?
questions.explanation: PSR 020209 explicitly prohibits public officers from being members of secret societies or cults.

questions.question: Which of the following is required before an appointment on probation can be confirmed?
questions.explanation: Confirmation of appointment requires satisfactory performance, passing prescribed examinations, and meeting other conditions as may be specified.

questions.question: Which PSR rule governs transfer of officers within the Federal Public Service?
questions.explanation: PSR 020212 contains provisions regarding the transfer of officers within the Federal Public Service.

questions.question: According to PSR 030301, confirmation of officers holding senior posts requires approval from:
questions.explanation: PSR 030301 mandates that confirmation of officers in senior posts must be approved by the Federal Civil Service Commission.

questions.question: Which of the following documents is mandatory for new officers at the point of entry?
questions.explanation: PSR 020211 requires new officers to present evidence of age, educational qualifications, and other relevant documents at the point of entry.

questions.question: Promotion of officers in the Civil Service is primarily processed by:
questions.explanation: The Civil Service Commission is responsible for the promotion of officers in the Federal Civil Service as per PSR 020701.

questions.question: Which of the following does PSR 020205 define as a 'temporary appointment'?
questions.explanation: PSR 020205 defines a temporary appointment as one made pending confirmation of the officer's eligibility for permanent appointment.

questions.question: PSR 020302 stipulates that probationary officers who show unsatisfactory conduct should:
options: Have their probation extended by 5 years
Be terminated or have probation extended
questions.explanation: PSR 020302 provides that probationary officers who show unsatisfactory conduct may have their appointment terminated or probation extended.

questions.question: Who is responsible for keeping personal records of all officers in Ministries according to PSR 020108?
questions.explanation: PSR 020108 designates the Head of Personnel Management as responsible for maintaining personal records of all officers in the Ministry.

questions.question: According to PSR 020303, what is the maximum period for which an officer's probation can be extended?
questions.explanation: PSR 020303 states that probation can be extended for a maximum period of one year if the officer's performance is not satisfactory but shows potential for improvement.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid ground for rejection of confirmation under PSR 030302?
questions.explanation: PSR 030302 lists grounds for rejection of confirmation including unsatisfactory performance, failure to pass examinations, and medical unfitness, but political affiliation is not a valid ground.

questions.question: PSR 020702 states that promotion in the Civil Service is based on all EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: PSR 020702 emphasizes that promotion is based on seniority, merit, and availability of vacancies, and should never be influenced by political considerations.

questions.question: What is the minimum period an officer must spend on a grade level before being considered for promotion under normal circumstances?
questions.explanation: The general rule under PSR 020704 is that an officer must spend a minimum of 3 years on a grade level before being considered for promotion, unless otherwise specified.

questions.question: Which body is responsible for conducting promotion examinations for the Civil Service?
options: Office of the Head of Service
questions.explanation: The Public Service Institute of Nigeria (PSIN) is responsible for conducting promotion examinations for the Civil Service as part of the promotion process.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the confirmation process as stated in PSR 030201?
options: To assess fitness for permanent appointment
To transfer the officer to another department
questions.explanation: PSR 030201 states that the confirmation process is designed to assess whether an officer is fit for permanent appointment based on performance during probation.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about acting appointments is FALSE according to PSR 020206?
options: Acting appointments can be made when a post is vacant
Acting appointments require approval of the appropriate authority
questions.explanation: PSR 020206 specifies that acting appointments do not count towards promotion and are made on a temporary basis when a post is vacant or the substantive holder is absent.

questions.question: PSR 020401 states that an officer may be seconded for a maximum period of:
questions.explanation: According to PSR 020401, secondment of an officer should not exceed four years in the first instance, though it may be extended in special circumstances.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid reason for rejection of confirmation under PSR 030304?
options: Inability to get along with colleagues
questions.explanation: PSR 030304 lists specific grounds for rejection of confirmation, and while interpersonal issues may be a concern, they are not explicitly listed as a ground for rejection.

questions.question: PSR 020705 states that promotion to the post of Permanent Secretary requires the approval of:
questions.explanation: PSR 020705 specifically requires that appointments to the post of Permanent Secretary must be approved by the President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

questions.question: According to PSR 020702, what is the primary basis for promotion in the Civil Service?
questions.explanation: PSR 020702 clearly states that promotion in the Civil Service is based on a combination of seniority and merit, ensuring a balance between experience and demonstrated competence.

questions.question: What is the minimum number of years an officer must spend on a grade level before being considered for promotion under normal circumstances?
questions.explanation: The general rule under PSR 020704 is that an officer must spend a minimum of 3 years on a grade level before being considered for promotion, unless otherwise specified.
